main event: A meteorologist observed a bright circular object in the sky over White Plains, New York on December 6, 1963, which disappeared after a few minutes.
interesting points: The object was first seen as a dull yellow light at low altitude before it quickly headed west and vanished,The witness, S. Davis Childs, described the object as brighter than any star or planet,The sighting lasted approximately 3 to 5 minutes,The object exhibited unusual behavior, not resembling any conventional aircraft,The report was documented under Project Blue Book and involved additional inquiries from military personnel.
